contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox musical artist |name = Fat Truckers |background = group_or_band |origin = [[Sheffield]], [[England]] |genre = [[Electroclash]] |years_active = 2000â€“2004 |label =Roadtrain Recordings<br/>[[International DeeJay Gigolo Records]] |past_members = Ben Rymer<br/>Mark Hudson<br/>[[Ross Orton]] }} The '''Fat Truckers''' were a [[United Kingdom|British]] [[electroclash]] band from [[Sheffield]], comprising Ben Rymer, Mark Hudson and [[Ross Orton]] and briefly augmented by [[Jason Buckle]] and Ginger Dave as a part-time members. They toured in support of Jarvis Cocker, apparently wielding light sabres on stage and described themselves as writing songs about "cheap motorbikes, import-export business and multiplex cinemas - we're a social comment on modern living" and having a fondness of [[Henderson's Relish]].<ref name="GuardianThewaywelistennow">{{cite news|title=The way we listen now|work=[[The Guardian]]|publisher=[[Guardian Media Group]]|date=3 May 2002|url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/lifeandstyle/2002/may/03/shopping.artsfeatures |accessdate=7 March 2009 | location=London | first=Alexis | last=Petridis}}</ref> The band split up in 2004. Orton now works in production with [[Pulp (band)|Pulp]]'s [[Steve Mackey]], and has recently worked with [[M.I.A. (artist)|M.I.A.]]. Rymer DJs as part of Gucci Soundsystem and Hudson has his own band Meat For A Dark Day. ==Discography== ===Albums=== *''[[The First Fat Truckers Album Is for Sale]]'' (2003) ===Singles=== * "Superbike" (2003) * "Teenage Daughter" (2003) * "Anorexic Robot" (2003) ===Remixes=== * [[Louie Austen]] featuring [[Peaches (musician)|Peaches]] - "[[Grab My Shaft]]" (2003) ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://web.archive.org/web/20020212043542/http://www.fattruckers.co.uk/ Fat Truckers website] *[http://www.nme.com/reviews/the-rapture/7202 The Rapture] at Reviews on www.nme.com *[http://www.sandmanmagazine.co.uk/oldsite/sheffield/features/009/fattruckers/truckers.html Lengthy interview and pictures] from [[Sandman (magazine)]] [[Category:English electronic music groups]] [[Category:Music in Sheffield]] {{UK-electronic-band-stub}}
